content.description:
Gain the good sharp crimps, and via a high step and sidepull reach up to the sloping finishing holds.

Good crimpy climbing for the grade.

The area classic. An off balance move gets a foot established on the shelf 4' off the ground, grab the vertical seam/crack and stand up. Move up on mediocre to bad feet and small crimps to a good handhold near the lip, then go way over the top to a positive hueco.
content.location: About 10 feet left of the scoop where Scuttlebutt starts is a sloping shelf at chest height and a short vertical tips crack/seam just above which ends after a couple of feet.

content.description: Make a high-step smear into the concave scoop and reach up to a sloper, stand it up and mantle into lower angle terrain directly above.
content.location: On the far right side of the Manx boulders, just left of the Right Arete starting in a concave scoop and finishing straight up. Descend by chimneying down between the two Manx boulders.

content.description: This short arete problem is one of the easiest on this circuit and a decent warm up. A couple of sidepull moves gain lower angle terrain.
content.location: On the far right side of the Manx boulders, facing Cyclops. To descend, either downclimb this problem, or the easy chimney between the two boulders.

content.description:
Start up left of the obvious flake.   Move right to the flake and then right again onto the arete.

Work your way up the arete and make a big move for the right to gain a good sidepull.   Make another to better holds, and then mantle the lip.
content.location: Right edge of left block on the North side

content.description:
This problem lies on the north face of the Manx Boulder directly behind a dying tree. Start at the obvious sloping ledge and make a big move to gain the lip, then press out a mantel with tree branches at your back (a little scary) to complete the problem.

UPDATE: Tree gone since 2007 or so.
content.protection: Spotters and one or more crashpads.

content.description:
Climb the easy crack.

Not much of a climb, but it can act as a good descent.
content.location:
Around the arete from

Out of Touch

.

content.description:
You'll find this short problem on the left side of the Manx Boulders, about 20' left of

Off Camber

(V4).

Lieback a large, gritty flake to an easy mantle at the top. Fun moves throughout but the rock quality (or lack thereof) detract somewhat. Wearing a long-sleeved shirt is a plus. One star out of five.
Climb up and gain the left slanting rail.   From here reach up to the dish and finish out on slopers.
content.location: Just to the right of the central break.

content.description:
This short but engaging problem is on the far left side of the Manx Boulders just left of Grunge (V0), an obvious lieback flake, and about 30' left of Off Camber (V4).

A short section of liebacking gives way to a rounded top where one must make the most of slopers and dishes before pulling over the top. One star out of five.

A fun problem that is a good bit easier for tall people. Make a long move to a crimp, step up onto a bad foot and grab the undercling. Mantle over the top on good slopers. For short people, getting the undercling will likely be the crux, for taller people the topout.
content.location: Just left of Undertow, going to an obvious undercling flake about 8ft off the ground. Descend by chimneying down between the two boulders.
